text: Drought-affected farmers and businesses could be given an exemption from income tax under a new proposal being considered by the Morrison government. Under the plan, the federal government would also pressure the states to suspend payroll tax. Home Affairs Minister Peter Dutton said the government “put $7 billion on the table already, are working closely with the states and will do whatever it takes to support farmers”. “All of us are desperate to help farmers in anyway we can,” he said. Deputy Labor leader Richard Marles said government infighting on the issue showed it was more focused on itself than struggling farmers. Image: News Corp Australia
